intro: Cryptantha hoffmannii, commonly known as Hoffmann's cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain seeds that are dispersed by wind. Cryptantha hoffmannii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
